algorithms.search

Interface UninformedSearch<V,E extends Edge>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - - Vertex type
    E - - Edge type must extend edge class
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BreadthFirstSearch, DepthFirstSearch

    public interface UninformedSearch<V,E extends Edge>
    Generic interface for uninformed search algorithms

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  UninformedSearch.ExtendedVertex<T>
      Private wrapper class to store user vertices with some additional info
      static class  UninformedSearch.OriginalVertexPaint<V>
      Vertex painting class for the original graph, colours the root node differently than the others.
      static class  UninformedSearch.SearchVertexPaint<V>
      Simple vertex paint class, colours vertices based on their layed in the search tree

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Collection<V> getDirectedNeighbours(edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.Graph<V,E> userGraph, V currentNode)
      Scans all outward edges from the current node and adds the destination to the collection of neighbours.
      java.util.List<V> search(edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.Graph<V,E> graph, V root)
      Main search method.
      void visualizeSearch(edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.Graph<V,E> graph, V root)
      Performs the same search functionality except it displays the graph and highlights the order nodes were traversed.

    • Method Detail

      • search

        java.util.List<V> search(edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.Graph<V,E> graph,
                         V root)
        Main search method.
        Parameters:
        root - - The root node to search from.
        Returns:
        - A list indicating the order nodes were traversed, or a null list if the root is not in the graph.

      • visualizeSearch

        void visualizeSearch(edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.Graph<V,E> graph,
                     V root)
        Performs the same search functionality except it displays the graph and highlights the order nodes were traversed.
        Parameters:
        root - - The node to start from.

      • getDirectedNeighbours

        java.util.Collection<V> getDirectedNeighbours(edu.uci.ics.jung.graph.Graph<V,E> userGraph,
                                              V currentNode)
        Scans all outward edges from the current node and adds the destination to the collection of neighbours.
        Parameters:
        userGraph - The graph being searched.
        currentNode - The node who's neighbours we are looking for
        Returns:
        A collection of nodes
